meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel embarrassed, ashamed, or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: Seeing his old school crush at the reunion mortifies him.
meanings.sent2: She mortifies easily when she makes a mistake in public.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter accidentally spilled soup on the customer, which mortified them.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's harsh criticism mortifies the shy student.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing video of him dancing awkwardly mortifies him every time he watches it.

meanings.definition: To subdue (the body or its needs and desires) by self-denial or discipline.
meanings.sent1: He mortifies his sweet tooth by avoiding sugary treats.
meanings.sent2: She mortifies her desire to sleep in by waking up early for a jog.
meanings.sent3: The dieter mortifies her cravings for junk food by snacking on carrots.
meanings.sent4: The monk mortifies his flesh through fasting and prayer.
meanings.sent5: To achieve his fitness goals, he mortifies his laziness by working out daily.
